intro: Turraea tugelensis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically surrounded by bracts. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
